body.p: You can open an archive in the Archive Browser view by doing one of the following:

ul.li: Open an archive from the Project view.
Choose an archive in the file chooser dialog box.
Drag an archive from the file explorer and drop it in the Archives Browser view.

body.p: When displaying an archive, the Archive Browser view locks the archive file. It is then automatically unlocked when the Archive Browser view is closed.

You can navigate archives either by opening them from the Navigator or by using the integration with the Eclipse File System. For the EFS (Eclipse File System) integration you must right-click the archive in the Navigator and choose Expand Zip Archive. All the standard Eclipse Navigator actions are available on the mounted archive. If you decide to close the archive you can use the Collapse ZIP Archive action located in the contextual menu for the expanded archive. Any file opened from the archive expanded in the EFS will be closed when the archive in unmounted.
If you open an archive as an Eclipse editor, the archive will be unmounted when the editor is closed.
body.note: If a file is not recognized by as a supported archive type, you can add it from the Archive preferences page.

section.title: Archive Browser Toolbar
section.p: The following actions are available on the Archive Browser toolbar:

dlentry.dd: You can use this drop-down to reopen recently edited archives. Apart from the history of the recently edited archives, the drop-down also contains the Clear history and Open Archive actions.

Provides access to the Open Archive action that opens a new archive in the browser. If the extension is not known as an archive extension, you will be directed to the Archive preferences page to add a new extension. The sub-menu keeps a list of recently open archive files and a Clear history action that allows you to delete the list.
Closes the browsed archive and unlocks the archive file.

Adds existing files as children of the selected folder in the browsed archive. You can also add files in the archive by dragging them from the file browser or Project view and dropping them in the Archive Browser view.
Deletes the selected resource in the browsed archive.

section.p: The following additional operations are available from the Archive Browser contextual menu:

dlentry.dd: Opens a resource from the archive in the editor.
Extracts a resource from the archive in a specified folder.
Adds existing files as children of the selected folder in the browsed archive. On OS X, the Add file action is also available and it allows you to add one file at a time.
Renames a resource in the archive.
Allows you to search for and replace specific pieces of text inside the archive.
Paste a file or folder into the archive. You can add files in the archive by copying the files from the Project view and paste them into the Archive view.
Remove a file or folder from archive.
Previews an image contained in the archive See the Image Preview section for more details.
Copies the URL location of the selected resource.
Views properties for the selected resource.
